message_1:
Suppose you intercept a ciphertext that was encrypted using the Hill cipher with a key matrix of:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
5 & 8 \\
22 & 9
\end{bmatrix}
$$

The ciphertext is:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
8 & 0 & 19 & 19 & 13 & 11 & 13 & 19 & 02 & 19 & 13 & 0 & 13 & 9 \\
\end{bmatrix}
$$

Using cryptanalysis, find the plaintext message.
message_2:
To decrypt the message, we first need to find the inverse of the key matrix. The key matrix is:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
5 & 8 \\
22 & 9
\end{bmatrix}
$$

To find the inverse, we need to calculate the determinant, which is:

$$
\det(K) = (5 \times 9) - (8 \times 22) = 45 - 176 = -131
$$

Since we are working with modulo 26, we need to find the modular inverse of the determinant:

$$
-131 \equiv 1 \pmod{26}
$$

The modular inverse of -131 is 3 (since -131 * 3 = -393, and -393 â‰¡ 1 mod 26).

Now we can find the adjugate of the key matrix:

$$
\text{adj}(K) = 
\begin{bmatrix}
9 & -8 \\
-22 & 5
\end{bmatrix}
$$

Now, multiply the adjugate matrix by the modular inverse of the determinant:

$$
K^{-1} = 3 \times \text{adj}(K) =
\begin{bmatrix}
27 & -24 \\
-66 & 15
\end{bmatrix}
\equiv
\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 2 \\
10 & 15
\end{bmatrix}
\pmod{26}
$$

Now we have the inverse key matrix. We can use this to decrypt the ciphertext:

Ciphertext:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
8 & 0 & 19 & 19 & 13 & 11 & 13 & 19 & 02 & 19 & 13 & 0 & 13 & 9 \\
\end{bmatrix}
$$

Group the ciphertext into pairs of numbers:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
8 & 0 \\
19 & 19 \\
13 & 11 \\
13 & 19 \\
02 & 19 \\
13 & 0 \\
13 & 9
\end{bmatrix}
$$

Multiply the inverse key matrix by each pair of numbers:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 2 \\
10 & 15
\end{bmatrix}
\times
\begin{bmatrix}
8 & 0 \\
19 & 19 \\
13 & 11 \\
13 & 19 \\
02 & 19 \\
13 & 0 \\
13 & 9
\end{bmatrix}
\equiv
\begin{bmatrix}
0 & 19 \\
4 & 4 \\
8 & 13 \\
19 & 7 \\
17 & 4 \\
0 & 13 \\
8 & 19
\end{bmatrix}
\pmod{26}
$$

Now convert the numbers back to letters (A = 0, B = 1, ..., Z = 25):

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
A & T \\
E & E \\
I & N \\
T & H \\
R & E \\
A & N \\
I & T
\end{bmatrix}
$$

The decrypted plaintext message is "AT EIN TH RE AN IT".
